Quote.Speaker: David Wallace
Quote.Text: ...No, you lied to me Andy. You pretended to be in this office for three months and you were sailing on your boat!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I resent that. I, I never lied to you.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Really? [reading from phone] "Hey David, all is good in Scranton PA."

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And all was good in Scranton PA that day.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: "By the way, Oscar says 'hi'"

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oscar says "hi" all the time. He says all kinds of greetings. "Hi" "Hello" "Hola" You're telling me you've never heard Oscar say "hi"?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: But you're calling me a liar.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Andy!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: By the way, that reminds me, I want to ask you about some of the lies you've been telling lately.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Watch it Andy!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh, here we go, January seventh 2013. [Reading from phone] "Hey Andy, all's well. Been meaning to make it down there but my wife's sick." Well, which is it?! Is all well or is your wife sick?! BUSTED!

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: My wife?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: This has been a really tough time.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Yeah?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Has it?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Erin just dumped me and I can't remember any of the aha moments I had on the boat, and I know it sounds weird to say but I really miss my beard.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Shh.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It was like a security blan-

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: -ket

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: Shh. I'm not gonna fire you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You're not?

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That's awesome.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: I wouldn't own the company if it wasn't for you. So...I owe you that.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: David, I'll be there for you. These five words I swear to you. When you breathe, I want to be here for you. I'll be there for you. That's a poem by J.B. Jovi. I want you to have it.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: We are even...now. Understand? Got it?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Crystal.

Quote.Speaker: David
Quote.Text: You are on very- Hey, very thin ice.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Vanilla. [David looks confused] Vanilla Ice. It was a band.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Good morning.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Good morning.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And how are you on this fine- [chokes up, runs into office and slams door pulling the blinds closed]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Crying] Ok, we ready? [cut] Don't use that part. Last week, Erin told me that our relationship would be proceeding without me. Now I have to see her everyday at work. Which is...brutal. When people say office relationships are a good idea, they never talk about what might happen if you break up.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [Moaning from office] Ahhh! Oooooh! ahh

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He sounds like a wounded animal.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Should've put him out of his misery and just fired her.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: I can't be around sad people, it makes me sad.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: I'm the same way with horny people.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ok. [Andy continues moaning]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yes. Pete and I have started seeing each other and Andy still doesn't know. We thought that keeping it secret was more considerate to him. And hot for us. I mean I saw Pete's butt. It's sick.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [taking paper from Kevin] Oh that's mine! Um, I'll just, I'll get it out of the way for you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Jim set up a job interview for me today in Philly. It's um, with a real estate company, which is a great fit for me because I live in a house and I know what a bathroom is. [laughs] I'm sorry, I am just very nervous because honestly this is all moving a lot faster than I expected. And, and because my resume can fit on a post-it note.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [on phone] No, don't just let her eat the grass, she'll puke it right up. OK, just put out two bowls and see which feed she prefers. I'm sorry to be taking up so much of your precious time, Mose, but she's your aunt too. Fine. I'll see what I can do.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: [Jumps out from behind vending machine] I need you.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Ahh! Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And you should take breaks more often, I've been waiting there for 45 minutes.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What? What is it?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's my aunt Shirley, she's on her last legs.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Dwight, that's awful.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You have no idea. I mean her hair, clothes, it's all falling off in great big clumps. And we need someone to go out there and clean her up. We had a nurse, but she quit because she was "poisoned" by Aunt Shirley.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: What do you mean by "poisoned"?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Probably nothing, or strychnine. Or lemonade and strychnine. Which is actually what it was.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Ok, well I'm very sorry about your aunt.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: But I don't see how this is my problem.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Angela. You owe me one, remember? Now please, she's an old woman Angela. She needs a woman's touch. It's all hanging out-

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Ugh.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And there's parts of her I don't even recognize.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Gah.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: There's this one hanging part in particular, that's some sort of flap.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It's fine.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's like a prehensile wing or something, you know?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Ugh! God, I can't. OK, I'll-

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's a divet...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I'll help you!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: ..where it was and it needs, it needs a...

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Ugh.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Where are you going?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Uh, not on a three month boat trip.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wha? Oh, burn. [laughs, Angela and Dwight move to leave.] Uh, excuse me. What, everyone can just leave whenever they want now?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: How dare you?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm still the boss!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: The answer is yes.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: ..just have some messages for you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Are they from you?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well no, they're from clients.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well then, I don't want them. You can keep 'em. In fact, you can keep that big blue Nautica sweater, I know how much you love it.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I can't. I-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Nope, I insist upon it. It's an awesome sweater. Some great memories tied up in that thing.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: These are messages from clients who want to buy paper.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I don't want to talk about work right now.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well I only want to talk about work right now.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Then I want my big blue sweater back.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well, I gave it to the Salvation Army.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: I've got the seat adjusted right.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Perfect height, yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: She got rid of it. My blue sweater. What is that about?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: I was just leaving.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Stay! We are in the bro-zone layer. Ok? Nard dog, Plop and Clarker Posey, AKA Clarkwork Orange. Here's the sitch: Erin dumped me, natch. But she got rid of my blue sweater, which was her favorite. Is she moving on a little fast, or am I being a total psycho? Plop, you go first.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: I don't know. Women do tend to move on quicker than men.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Survey says: ENH! Doesn't make me feel better at all. Zero Clark Thirty, what do you got?

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Look at it this way, being a bachelor is not all bad. I mean, you've got your freedom now.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Last night I ordered a pizza by myself and I ate it over the sink like a rat.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: There you go, good for you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: You just let it all hang out, that's what...

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: May not seem like it, but this really helped. So, thank you. [Andy leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: I'll give you a hundred dollars to wear that sweater to work tomorrow.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Aunt Shirley, Hello! It's me Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Shirley
Quote.Text: Oh, lookie here. It's big city Dwight. Careful you don't get mud on those fancy town shoes, big city Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Hello Aunt Shirley.

Quote.Speaker: Shirley
Quote.Text: Who's this little kitchen witch? She's so tiny like a little kitchen witch.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: This is Angela, and we brought you some new clothes!

Quote.Speaker: Shirley
Quote.Text: New clothes? What for? [Aunt Shirley's boob shows]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh, God.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You know what? Before you put the new clothes on, Angela's gonna get you cleaned up a little bit.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Yes. How would you like a nice warm bath?

Quote.Speaker: Shirley
Quote.Text: How would you like a mean cold slap? [slaps Angela]

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Ow!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok, Aunt Shirley, dear, uh, can I get you a nice crisp liter of schnapps?

Quote.Speaker: Shirley
Quote.Text: I could do that.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No. No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yeah, trust me.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It keeps her docile. Go to the kitchen, get the largest receptacle you can find.

Quote.Speaker: Shirley
Quote.Text: Step on it!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Why doesn't Erin seem sad? Has she found someone new or something? And if so, why hasn't she told me? Is she trying to spare my feelings? During breakups, the mind goes to some crazy dark places.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Andy, don't. No good can come from snooping.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I'm not snooping, there's just some crud on her screen.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You're clearly snooping.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: That's kinda uncool, man.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Ah, come on.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Andy!

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: That's her private property.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Tell us!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Uh, hello! Who's snooping on who now?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: What does that even mean?

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: What's it say?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Put it down.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Everyone please, just-

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: It's not cool.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Put it down

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Andy. That is her private property.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Boo.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Oh my god.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Uh huh.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: See?

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: That's where nosey'll get you.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Told you so.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Darryl, Clark, Toby, Kevin, Plop. Take a knee. Alright, you guys are gonna think I'm psycho again. Uh, couldn't shake this feeling that Erin's dating someone so I looked at her phone.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Man, you can't do that stuff. You'll only find pain. When my ex-wife got into my e-mail account, she was devastated.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Too late. I found out she's been texting a guy named Pete. Does anybody know a Pete?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Pete...

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Hmm.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Pete what?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: It just occurred to me that Andy has been calling me Plop for so long, he forgot my real name. Which is Pete.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [whispers] hello!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey! There she is. [Pam laughs] How you doin?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hi! Hey, do I look ok?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You look great.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ok

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [pointing to Jim's bluetooth headset] What's that? Is that a-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ok, I know where you're going with this, and this is who I am now. I'm a douche. But look what I can do with my hands. [Pam laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Isaac
Quote.Text: Gotta go, VIP just walked through the door.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: How are you, Isaac? You have something in your ear.

Quote.Speaker: Isaac
Quote.Text: It's a phone?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes. It is. And thank you so much for setting up this opportunity, I really appreciate it.

Quote.Speaker: Isaac
Quote.Text: Of course, anything for Team Halpert. You're gonna crush it, Pam.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You are gonna crush it. Wow, I missed you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wait, are you saying that into the phone or are you saying that to me.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [touches headset] Call you right back. What were you saying?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Ha ha.

Quote.Speaker: Athlead Coworker
Quote.Text: Hey, Jim! We've got Trent Edwards on the line.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I've gotta go, but you know what? Team Halpert, ok? You're gonna crush it, you're gonna smash it.[Pam laughs] OK, good luck!

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Bye.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Gosh, she drank so much. And so quickly.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: In her prime, Shirles could put away homemade schnapps morning noon and night.

Quote.Speaker: Shirley
Quote.Text: [coughs and laughs in her sleep]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Now all it takes is half a liter. She's dreaming. Alright, let's get her out to the yard so you can spray her down.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Spray her down?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, it's a lot better than it sounds. There's a private shower area. Very tasteful, very rustic.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Hey.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Come on in. Have a seat. Uh, thanks for coming in, I just gotta get something off my chest. I just got some really weird news and uh, I'm just gonna come out and say it. I just got off the phone with my doctor, and it turns out I contracted [reading computer screen] shlmydia...from Erin. And it's incurable. Pretty lame huh?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Yeah. [long pause] You were gone.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: I knew it!

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: For a long time, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You and Erin are fuhhhhhhherraaaaa!

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Andy, just so you know, there was no overlap.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No overlap? Great. Good. Wow. This is suddenly so easy. Guess what? You're fired!

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: What?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah. You. Are. Fired! One of the perks of being boss. I can fire anyone who steals my girlfriend. And wow, that turns out to be you. Yup. Sorry. [singing] So you had a bad day-

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Andy?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: ..The camera don't lie!

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: You're being an idiot get..

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: I'm trying..

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Out of my office, turns out you're fired...

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Because you suck.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: You can't fire-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And you're fired...

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: If you want to talk to me

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: So you had a bad day...

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: I'll be in the annex.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Rut ti doh doh...

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Alright? I'll be in the annex.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Rut tit doh doh...

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Toby!

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Rut ti doh doo doh

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Toby?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: You can't fire Pete. You understand why, right?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Oh, Andy, we had this exact same conversation when you wanted to get rid of Nellie. You can't just get rid of people over grudges.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Nellie was a professional grudge. This is a purely personal grudge.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Alright, well look. While I have you here, this is a relationship disclosure form for Pete & Erin.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: They already have a contract? [Reading] "Mutually agree to-" Ah, every phrase is like a dagger in my crotch.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: It's just boiler plating, you don't have to read it.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Well, I'm not signing away my rights.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I already signed it. I was just showing you.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ok, well we'll see about that. [crumples paper]

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Andy, it's not the original. And destroying it will not stop them from dating. Andy. [Andy throws paper at him and leaves, Toby straightens paper out] It's the original.

Quote.Speaker: Mark
Quote.Text: ...[singing] talking Chester avenue, talking triplex, talking converting...Is that her? Hey guys! Say something.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hello.

Quote.Speaker: Mark
Quote.Text: Hi, I'm Mark.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hi, Pam, hello.

Quote.Speaker: Mark
Quote.Text: I'm the horrible boss around here, but please don't hire Jamie Foxx to kill me. D'Jango! I don't agree with the use of the "N" word in that movie. It's, it's too soon.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm Pam Halpert.

Quote.Speaker: Mark
Quote.Text: Oh, hi. They call me Marky Mark around here, because here at Simon Realty, we are one funky bunch! Come on you guys, raise the roof when I say that! I- what are you all temps again today? Let's go, Gangnam style. [laughs] He's heard Gangnam style, he knows it. Right? That's cause he's American. This is Carl. Uh, he's from here. Our neck of the woods. But Gangnam style is great, isn't it?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my god. He's Michael Scott.

Quote.Speaker: Shirley
Quote.Text: Time to get clean!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: It's hosing time Aunt Shirley, have a seat. You're gonna have a hard time hearing her over the roar of the hose.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You have to use chains?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: You'll see. Here we go.

Quote.Speaker: Shirley
Quote.Text: Let's get this show on the road.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's do it! Ready? Here's a box cutter to get her clothes off.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Let's get to it.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No! No!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Give it a whirl.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Dwight, I am not gonna hose your aunt down like some animal.

Quote.Speaker: Shirley
Quote.Text: Stop your belly-aching and hose me.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I need you to hose my aunt.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: OK you are useless.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, Dwight!

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Give me the hose!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No Dwight, I won't- [hoses Dwight]

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ahh! OK!

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: [grunting] I'm gonna give your aunt a proper bath and a haircut like a lady! And you two are gonna shut up about it! Do you have a bathtub?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Yes ma'am.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Good.

Quote.Speaker: Mark
Quote.Text: This is not an office so much as it is a uh, rec room with a bunch of computers in it. Frankly, if I had my way, I'd toss the computers in the gar-bage. But unfortunately we use them for practically everything we do. So. That ain't gonna happen. He's a temp, don't worry about him. Alice! Alright, stay awake ok?

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hey Nellie. Mmm. I am so sick of February. It's the shortest month but it sure doesn't feel that way. We should catch up.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Um.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Y'know I've been going over my notes from the trial...

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Oh no.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: ...feel like I may have glossed over a few...

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: No no no no.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: ...minor points.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: No. Toby, you cannot keep blathering on about this Scranton Strangler. Do something about it. Get it out of your system, whatever it takes.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I've been drafting a letter.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: For two years! Then what? Another year picking out a stamp? Another six months before you decide to lick it? Just- I don't want to hear it!

Quote.Speaker: Mark
Quote.Text: My aunt Joan. Oh, uh well, she uh, she worked here before I did, so there's no nepotism involved. In fact, to be honest with you I'm probably a little harder on her than I am on the rest of these people. Ah, cute. Not work on this...work on this months. Ok Nana? Uh, when I say "Chillax" people chillax. Watch this. Hey Roger, chillax! Must not have heard me.

Quote.Speaker: Roger
Quote.Text: No. I heard you.

Quote.Speaker: Mark
Quote.Text: Step this way for The Spanish Inquisition! [laughs] Kids in the Hall. Just, it's not high pressure. Just a little Coffee Talk. Ok? Like butta. Come on in here. Mike Myers.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [Mouths] Oh my god.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you! Thanks, thanks a lot. Really appreciate it. You guys are supposed to have my back. OK? Instead you let a guy named Plop steal my girlfriend.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Hey boss, I did everything I could. I invited Pete out for drinks, I emailed him shots of my junk....

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Ugh.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Kid doesn't have a romantic bone in his body.

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Come on Andy, they're a good match.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: That doesn't matter. Ok? What matters is that I am hurt! Deep hurt inside of me. I don't care if they're Romeo and freaking Juliet! I feel like the guy that Juliet dated before Romeo. Probably her boss. And guess what? Juliet's boss also had feelings.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Hey, Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: What?!

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: You've got a booger bubble going on there.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [wipes nose] Sorry.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: It's ok.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: My whole life is a booger bubble!

Quote.Speaker: Mark
Quote.Text: This is a tiny resume. Papa Smurf! Come back to the mushroom. [Pam laughs] From The Smurfs movie.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, I've seen that with my kids. Um, it is tiny, but I've actually been commissioned by the City of Scranton to paint a mural-

Quote.Speaker: Mark
Quote.Text: What does this say here? To ti te per tat... what language is this? Swahili? Oh wait a second, now I can read it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, cause it was upside down. [both laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Mark
Quote.Text: You're a good audience. [Pam laughs]

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So um-

Quote.Speaker: Mark
Quote.Text: Unlike some of these people around here.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yeah, the um, the city commissioned me to do the-

Quote.Speaker: Mark
Quote.Text: Yeah, we don't have a lot of call for doodling around here. But I like this resume and here's why. It shows that you stick around. Yeah. You don't jump ship easily. Like a lot of these people. I mean they worship me you know? But do they like me? I mean...you think they like me, Pam?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Mark
Quote.Text: [gets guitar] What if Bob Dylan was your boss? I'm gonna do Dylan! [playing guitar and imitating Bob Dylan] Pam Halpert is my name, and I've been at Dunder Mifflin for seven years? Eight years? Eight years, man. Got the Dunder Mifflin blues. Got the Pam Halpert blues. Got the pra- went to the Pratt Institute...You have children?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Two children, yes.

Quote.Speaker: Mark
Quote.Text: You wrote Art and Painting, kinda the same thing. Kinda the same thing. Sometimes I repeat myself, but that's just being Pam. Well I'm kinda cute and I'm- but I'm married so...leave that be.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Hey. You got a sec to talk?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Kinda painful to chat with you Pete. Ever since the old one-two punch to my scrotum pole. Translation: penis. Translation? My manhood.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Yeah. Look, uh I understand breakups are tough. You know, it happens to all of us at some point in life. But you've gotta move on.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Great advice. Thank you, you can leave now.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Listen to him, Andy. He's trying to tell you something that you really need to hear.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Awesome perspective. Thanks for butting in.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Well, I've been where you are now. I dated this girl Alice and it was an ugly breakup. She worked at a marketing agency right next to my house. I'd run into her every day but I had to grow up and deal with it, and I did. We're even Facebook friends now.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: See? We can all be friends!

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Just, get over it. It doesn't have to be awkward.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: I do think we can have a fair....

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Yeah, so life gives you lemons and you've just gotta eat them, rinds and all. And if you don't want to eat them? Your ex-girlfriend will shove them down your throat with the help of her hunky new boyfriend. So that's fun.

Quote.Speaker: Mark
Quote.Text: Nothing to see here! Boss at work. This will be your desk. Right up front. Best seat on the roller coaster, you must be this tall to ride this ride. No pregnant women allowed. Are you? Uh, yeah I don't- not allowed to ask. So...

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I am not pr-

Quote.Speaker: Mark
Quote.Text: You're not.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Pregnant, no.

Quote.Speaker: Mark
Quote.Text: I didn't ask her if she was pregnant. She just offered it. The last three girls here all got pregnant.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Wow.

Quote.Speaker: Mark
Quote.Text: Don't be afraid, it's a different chair. I don't want a guy up here. I want to you know, see a woman come in and do a great job. Something that, I have to look out this window, I want someone-

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I'm sorry I thought this job was for the position of office manager.

Quote.Speaker: Mark
Quote.Text: It is. Yeah, you would uh manage this office. Answer the phones and forward the calls and uh you know, go for a coffee run now and again.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So, kinda like a receptionist.

Quote.Speaker: Mark
Quote.Text: Yeah, like a receptionist, but we call you the office manager because uh, it's less demeaning. By the way, how long are these uh, cameras gonna be following you around? Because I think this is pretty cool. Pretty pretty cool. Larry David, Curb Your Enthusiasm. Do you like that show?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Yes.

Quote.Speaker: Mark
Quote.Text: Well, I think they indulge themselves a little too much. I like scripted.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I spent 10 years as a receptionist, to Michael Scott. And I have kids now. And I just, I can't.

Quote.Speaker: Shirley
Quote.Text: Ow! The braid is too tight.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh hush. Loose braids reflect a loose character. Now stay still.

Quote.Speaker: Shirley
Quote.Text: Yes ma'am.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I think your hair is much too long for your age, by the way.

Quote.Speaker: Shirley
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: There.

Quote.Speaker: Shirley
Quote.Text: Thank you Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: I'm going to the prison. This afternoon. I'm gonna talk to the strangler.

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: Probably best to use his real name rather than strangler.

Quote.Speaker: Darryl
Quote.Text: Don't use his real name. George Howard Scubb. It's a devil name.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Well I just wanted to say I'm doing it. [Toby leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: He's doing it.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [on phone] hey!

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey, how'd the interview go?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh my gosh, wait until you. This guy was unbelievable. Ok so-

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I can't wait to hear about it later. Do you want to come in at eight? And uh, don't eat because I'm ordering in.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Eight? Really?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'll make it worth your while, I promise.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Sure. I mean, it's Philly. I can kill four hours. So uh, yeah. I'll see you at eight.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright, love you.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Love you.

Quote.Speaker: Alice
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Alice
Quote.Text: I'm here from BCI Marketing Consultants to meet with Andrew Bernard.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yes. The consultant. Andy said you can start right away so I will take you to your desk.

Quote.Speaker: Alice
Quote.Text: Ok, great. Thanks.

Quote.Speaker: Meredith
Quote.Text: Fresh meat! Fresh meat! [Making kissing noises]

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Just keep walking, don't give her anything. She'll take it and run. I'm Erin by the way.

Quote.Speaker: Alice
Quote.Text: Nice to meet you. Cute sweater.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh, thanks. Your shoes match. I'm bad at small talk.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: I'm Kevin.

Quote.Speaker: Alice
Quote.Text: Pete?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Alice. Oh man.

Quote.Speaker: Alice
Quote.Text: It's uh, been a while, huh?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: What, do you two know each other?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Yeah. We uh, have a history.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Oh.

Quote.Speaker: Alice
Quote.Text: History. Wow, ok. We dated for two years.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: That's so random.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Well. Is it?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Andy also hired a management consultant today. Oh no. [runs to front office]

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: Hey Erin, look who's back. The bird man.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Hello beautiful.

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Didn't you two used to do it?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: We absolutely did. Thank you for remembering that.

Quote.Speaker: Creed
Quote.Text: She's looking good.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: Hi, I'm uh, Toby Flenderson. I'm here to see George Howard Scubb.

Quote.Speaker: Toby
Quote.Text: This is the prison. Uh, I am not going in there with expectations, per say. Uh, I will meet George Howard Scubb. I will tell him that I believe he is innocent. I would understand if he felt motivated to hug me. I would understand if a friendship began. How did, how did Bogart put it? [imitating Humphrey Bogart] I think this is a start of my first friendship.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: So Pete was a librarian?

Quote.Speaker: Alice
Quote.Text: He worked as a librarian freshman year.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: Was he like the sexy librarian?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Ok.

Quote.Speaker: Alice
Quote.Text: Is there like somebody who's in charge of marketing? Maybe I should sit near him or her.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Alice
Quote.Text: Hi.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hi, how's it going?

Quote.Speaker: Alice
Quote.Text: Hi. [laughs] Good. I'd love to discuss strategy with you if you have a marketing p-

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Wow this sure is intense. Having to share a workspace with someone you used to get it on with?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Andy, that is really inappropriate.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Awkward.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: It is awkward. This is a really uncomfortable situation that you've contrived.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: [high pitched] Really uncomfortable situation.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: It's alright Pete, you can handle it. I mean we all just gotta "move on". Ain't that right professor lecture much? Uh, question. How's that medicine taste? Your own flavored? Is it just me or have these tables turned? Hmm. Hmm. [leaves]

Quote.Speaker: Alice
Quote.Text: So there's no marketing department.

Quote.Speaker: Clark
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: No.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: You know, times were tough. I was unemployed, I was still heart-broken over you, I've lost a good fifty pounds. But as you can see I put all that weight right back on. Feel how fat my buttocks are. Yeah, it's crazy. Touch it. It's like a warm pumpkin.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: So Andy just called you up out of the blue?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Yeah. He told me you two broke up.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Yeah.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: You must be pretty horny. [Erin shakes head no]

Quote.Speaker: Nellie
Quote.Text: well, the good news is no more guilty conscience. At least you know he is the strangler. The proof is in the grip. Did they say when the vocal cords would heal? [Toby nods] One week? [Toby shakes head] Ok, two weeks? [Toby nods] Ok. You offered your neck in search of the truth. The proud neck of justice. Isn't that the expression? No. Well, anyway, it was, it was very brave. It really was quite brave.

Quote.Speaker: Shirley
Quote.Text: I feel like a show pony.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: And you look like one too. Thank you Angela.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: You're welcome. Would you like some stew?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: By all means. And I will carve the roast skunk. Angela?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Mmhm.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Would you like the stink sack?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Is it any good?

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: No, you don't eat it. It's a toy, like a wish bone. You know, prettiest girl gets the stink sack.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Thank you. [both laugh]

Quote.Speaker: Shirley
Quote.Text: So, when's the wedding?

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Oh, um actually uh, we are just friends.

Quote.Speaker: Shirley
Quote.Text: That's what Mose said about his lady scarecrow and look what he did to that poor thing.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Hello?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Hey! Back here.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, wow. Seriously? Oh my gosh, is that champagne?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Si, senor.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, Jim I should have told you I didn't get the job.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Oh man. I'm so sorry. Are you alright?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, yeah. I'm more than alright. There's just nothing to celebrate.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Are you kidding? We're in Philly. We're having dinner together. And this is just consolation champagne. It's from the part of France that immediately gave up to the Nazis. Here.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [laughs] You're very quick on your feet. I remember you. Funny.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Alright. So, tell me all about it.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Ok. Well, gosh. Thank you for your help today. Your perspective was very useful. Thank you.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: It was not an unpleasant way to spend an afternoon. [They shake hands. Then kiss] Dwight, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Right. Not outside. The horseflies. You know what? My farm is only a few acres East of here. Or, we could use the slaughterhouse.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: No, Dwight. The Senator.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Leave him. He probably won't even notice that you're gone. Be with me, Monkey.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I can't be your monkey, Dwight.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: I'm not talking about some frisky romp in the warehouse. We have wasted too much of our lives ignoring the fact that we belong together. The eighty or ninety years that I have left in this life...I want to spend with you.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: I made a vow. I gave my word.

Quote.Speaker: Dwight
Quote.Text: Stand by your man. It's what I would want if you were mine.

Quote.Speaker: Angela
Quote.Text: Good night, D.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: How are you doing? Is it really rough?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: It is so unpleasant. You?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Hey, love turds. Conference room, now.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Thank you all for coming in. Just wanted to check in. How is everyone's day?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Honestly, it was a little weird.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Really? Hmm. That's interesting. Because Erin and Pete thought it wouldn't be weird at all. Why do you think it was weird, Gabe? Maybe because you and Erin used to be an item?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I still wear Erin's button-downs around the condo sometimes. So it feels to me like we're still in a relationship-

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Gabe!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: ...a lot of the time.

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: And Alice, uh, I understand you once dumped Pete, ouch.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Dude, it was an amicable break up Andy.

Quote.Speaker: Alice
Quote.Text: Ok, while we're rewriting history, you never had a drinking problem.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: It was college. That is what you do.

Quote.Speaker: Alice
Quote.Text: Yeah you're also supposed to go to classes, so there's that.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Hey, Andy, is this at all work related?

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: We'll get to that. Gabe, did Erin ever tell you that she loves you?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: [laughs] Oh no no no no no no. She wouldn't even let me say it. It was adorable. She would plug her ears and scream her heat out.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Gabe, can you stop talking? Cause every word out of your mouth is like the squawk of an ugly pelican.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I got a tattoo for you.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I didn't ask you to get that Nike Swoosh. Nobody did! You did that for you!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Just do it. You were the it that I was just doing.

Quote.Speaker: Alice
Quote.Text: So you're dating a secretary now? Moving up in the world, Pete.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: She's nice to me.

Quote.Speaker: Alice
Quote.Text: How's that P.E. degree coming? That's what he wanted to be. His dream in college was to be a gym teacher.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Well, guess what? He could still be a gym teacher. In fact, we could all still be gym teachers, so, let's-

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I technically cannot. I don't have the lung capacity to blow a whistle.

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Oh my god.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: What kind of music are you into, Peter?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Uh, I like all kinds of music, Gabe.

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Really? All kinds? So you like songs of hate written by the white knights of the Ku Klux Klan?

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: No!

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Erin, are you even hearing this?

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: He didn't even say that.

Quote.Speaker: Alice
Quote.Text: He is not a very sophisticated man, I mean he can't even use chopsticks, so. Do I need to say anything else?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Erin, I've been to Japan. I know how to use chopsticks so well. Come back. One night.

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: Gabe, I don't-

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Give me one night with you...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: What is that supposed to mean?

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I have shaved everything...

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: I don't want you to shave everything.

Quote.Speaker: Alice
Quote.Text: I wasted two years of my life on you, you realize that right?!

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: I just want to be real clear that chopsticks is not the measure of a man. [Erin and Gabe argue in background]

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: I am as smooth as a porpoise. {Erin argues]

Quote.Speaker: Pete
Quote.Text: Why don't you say in the beginning: "This isn't really going that well"

Quote.Speaker: Gabe
Quote.Text: Shove his sashimi!

Quote.Speaker: Erin
Quote.Text: What do you-!

Quote.Speaker: Alice
Quote.Text: Because I had to wait- [all argue]

Quote.Speaker: Andy
Quote.Text: Alright, yes. That is a legitimate question. Does making Erin and Pete feel bad make me feel better? [Erin & Gabe and Alice & Pete argue in background] Yeah. Yeah, it does.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: So, imagine like the real estate version of Michael Scott and that was this guy. He did half the interview as Ace Ventura.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Tell me about the cologne. How much?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Oh, uh, entire bottle. At least.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: You're definitely hoarding this by the way.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Guess what poster he had on his wall?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Austin Powers.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: MmMm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Ferris Bueller.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: MmMm. You're getting colder.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: Not Night at the Roxbury.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: [laughs] No. The Odd Life of Timothy Green.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: I'm sorry, how did you think I was expected to guess that?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't know, but it's interesting right?

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: It's fascinating.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: He said he can't help but tear up when he looks at it. It's like right next to his desk. He must look at it twenty times a day.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: That's amazing. Well, listen. You can't win 'em all, right?

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Mmhm.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: So, next interview has to be better.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I don't know.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: What do you mean? Of course it will. You're amazing.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: I know. It's just even if it was, a great boss and a great job, I just, I don't know, I don't know if I want, um, I don't know if I want this.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: [long pause] Huh. This is a little out of left field.

Quote.Speaker: Pam
Quote.Text: Is it? I just, I liked our life in Scranton.

Quote.Speaker: Jim
Quote.Text: And I have started a business in Philadelphia. [Pam shrugs]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar's Computer
Quote.Text: My grandfather know. Mah Jong will be here to stay. Hobbies of the East continues in a moment.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: You could all be doing this, just saying.

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I watch way too many ads online and I don't do enough situps. So I bought these. Now, every time an ad pops up online, I get 30 seconds of ab blasting. I call it Ads for Abs. Ironically, I learned about the boots from an ad online.

Quote.Speaker: Stanley
Quote.Text: Why can't you just do regular sit-ups?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: I'll tell you why. Because...the floor...is...disgusting. Yeah, my trainer said everybody fails working out, that's how you win. Alright [tries to pull himself up] Ok. Kevin? A little help buddy?

Quote.Speaker: Kevin
Quote.Text: Oh, why don't your famous stomachs help you now?

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Can someone please help me?

Quote.Speaker: Phyllis
Quote.Text: Ow, these teas are hot, can someone help me please? [Erin moves Oscar out of the way for Phyllis]

Quote.Speaker: Oscar
Quote.Text: Just- People! I'm not going anywhere. Soon, my core will get strong again and when that happens I'll be able to- Head rush! Ah! Can someone please help me? [Kevin shuts door] I- Hey! I'm not going anywhere! I'll be right here! Oh that's not good. [Oscars computer reads: Coming this May: The Office: An American Workplace. Ten years in the making, a look at the lives and loves of an average American small business office.] Hey guys! I've got twenty bucks for anyone who will help me. Kevin, would you like a pizza?
